CatDescriptText: Mrs. Nina Mullins, housewife, West End, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 7, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Negroes should push for non-segregated cemeteries, or should they sponsor their own?"  Answer reads: "I think that Negroes should push for cemetery integration. It makes no difference when you are dead."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Nina Mullins wearing dark jacket with crest, standing in front of store display
